meanings.definition: To determine or estimate the worth or value of something.
meanings.sent1: I will valuate the price of my old bike before selling it.
meanings.sent2: Real estate agents often valuate properties to determine their market value.
meanings.sent3: Trying to valuate the value of friendship is like putting a price tag on happiness.
meanings.sent4: She could valuate the true meaning of success in the eyes of her loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to valuate the importance of honesty in their lives.

meanings.definition: To assess or appraise the quality or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: It is important to valuate the performance of employees regularly.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler will valuate the diamond ring to determine its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to valuate the new toy with great curiosity.
meanings.sent4: She could valuate the impact of music on her mood like a skilled critic.
meanings.sent5: The chef will valuate the taste of the dish before serving it to the customers.
